name: Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton San Jose Airport

reviews.text: Enough said in the title. Hotel is walking distance from the airport and everything was great. Breakfast was fantastic. On par with a resort from where we just came.
reviews.title: New, Clean, Good Service, and Breakfast

reviews.text: I'm fairly new to TA, but decided (after having a bad experience at a hotel) to try a semi-formatted approach to my reviews. I'll give a blurb about our stay, then list out pros, cons, tips (for guests), and recommendations (for management).  Please mark them as helpful if you think they are, so I can adjust as necessary (not sure if thats an option with the app...).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, we stayed here for a couple of reasons: decent review on TA, proximity to airport with free shuttle (we arrived late & wanted convenience), and known/expected quality level, given it's a US brand chain.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The shuttle passes by regularly, the check-in process was quick/easy with friendly bilingual staff, and the lobby/hotel appearance the same as in the States except for the addition of gorgeous local flora. The halls to the rooms have thick carpeting, which minimizes the sounds of people wheeling their luggage by your room. And considering how close you are to the airport, it was amazingly quiet.  The room itself was as pictured on their site, with comfortable beds, a tv (if you want it), and a/c.  Wifi was free, though in the room itself we had a semi-spotty signal when on the 3rd floor (we returned a week later, stayed on the 4th floor, and had better reception - go figure). There is also an ethernet cable provided, which we ended up connecting to our Apple Airport Express (yes, we're kind of techno geeks) for a superb, private wifi network. :-)
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the Airport

reviews.text: I made a reservation via Expedia to arrive on Sept.15th. The fee was paid in full. On Sept.15th my connecting flight to Costa Rica was cancelled. I called the hotel immediately to tell them I would not be there because of the cancelation. They said they couldn't do anything about it because it was booked by Expedia. I called Expedia and asked them to call the hotel. Nothing came of it. When I spoke to the manager, she told me the following: that due to fact that I had called AFTER the cancelation period (the cancelation period being the time being one day before I knew Aeromexico would cancel their flight), they could not allow me to stay at the hotel on Sept. 16th though they had plenty of rooms available. The manager there was Alexandra, she wasn't rude but she was completely unwilling to discuss the fact that I couldn't have guessed that the last flight leaving from Mexico would be cancelled. The hotel is good value for money, but management is unreasonable and oportunistic. Watch out.

reviews.text: This is my fourth stay. This is not a luxury hote but is very clean and nicely appointed. The staff is excellent and extremely helpful. As a father with two young boys, the hotel made for the perfect final stop on our way out of Costa Rica. The entire staff is very friendly and well trained to help travelers. We had a late flight and they allowed us a late checkout. The shuttle is very quick and efficient. I thought the cost was very reasonable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a late arrival to San Jose from New Jersey on December 1st so we decided to stay here and travel to the resort we were staying at the rest of our stay (December 2-10 at Rancho Pacifico in Uvita) the following morning. The Hampton Inn is right next to the Juan Santamaria International Airport. After my husband and I made our way to the exit for the taxis and shuttles, an airport employee asked us where we were going. We told him "Hampton Inn" and he immediately found a gentlemen (employed, I believe, by Hampton Inn) who directed us across the street to the free shuttle. The shuttle dropped us off at the hotel and we were relieved to be in a cool, very clean and spacious room after a long day of traveling. The free breakfast had a lot of different options and lots of fresh fruit. The front desk arranged for a taxi ride to the Tobias Airport for our flight on Nature Air to Uvita efficiently. One small issue occurred when I asked to pay the departure tax to avoid dealing with before our departure flight. The person at the front desk at the time apologized and advised me that they had run out of the necessary forms. I ate breakfast and saw that the small desk in the waiting room (with a sign regarding payment of departure taxes) was occupied by another gentlemen, who informed me that I could in fact, pay the departure taxes there). The moral of the story is to ignore the front desk if they tell you they ran out of forms and wait until the other gentleman who handles the departure taxes arrives at his (separate) desk. (Note also that you can pay the departure tax at the Tobias Airport as well). While the Hampton Inn is certainly generic, without any charm, and occupies a surreal Americanized area (complete with a Holiday Inn Express, a Denny's Restaurant, etc.) next to the airport and would probably not do for a much longer stay, it could not be closer to the airport, is exceptionally clean, the staff are friendly and generally very helpful, the breakfast is free and filling, and the beds are comfortable. In short, it's a reliable option if you need a short place to stay overnight.
reviews.title: Excellent point of arrival or departure for a stay in Costa Rica

reviews.text: My husband & I stayed in this hotel for two months on a business trip. We had to stay in this hotel as this is close to the airport where my husband is conducting his business. We are pleased by the helpful staff and their pleasant personalities and willingness to accomodate anything that we need with special mention of Susan, Daniela, Floribeth, Johanah, Allan, Joyselin & Manfred...also with the help of their shift manager, Steven... oh, before I forget, with a special mention of Maribel and Maricruz who make sure our room is always taken cared of.... the hotel is located near a very limited numbers of restaurants, and going around is not easy, you need to take a taxi all the time as the city is not conveniently built for walkers...no sidewalk to even go to a nearby restaurant...well, of course, Costa Rica is a third world country so you can't expect much...but the hotel staff made our stay comfortable....another thing, they offer very comforable beds and bedsheets and pillows....the hotel is very clean ( part of Hilton)...but one should be aware that the internet is not high speed and frequenly go off line but it's free as well as international calls anywhere in the US and the world which is a plus...
reviews.title: Very Nice Staff!

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites By Hilton San Jose Airport
description: An airport hotel with everything you need...welcome to the Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton San José - Airport. If you're looking for a hotel in the Central Valley, home of San José, Costa Rica’s capital city, look no further. Our Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton™ is the most conveniently located hotel in the area, just five minutes away from the International Airport, one block away from rental car return centers, and with easy access the Inter-American Highway (which transports you to beautiful beaches, national parks, and free trade areas).
